question: Has data stewardship improved business performance or efficiency?
Has the data directly contributed to increased revenue generation?
Has improved data management led to a reduction in operational costs?
Has effective data governance contributed to better risk management?
Are data-driven insights used to optimise internal processes and workflows?
Is there a structured feedback mechanism to assess the impact of data?
How comfortable are employees with interpreting and analysing data?
Do employees have access to structured training programmes to enhance their data literacy?
How often do employees engage with data-driven reports and dashboards?
Are employees encouraged to apply data insights in their daily operations?
Is there a dedicated team responsible for promoting data literacy across the organisation?
Do business leaders and managers receive training on leveraging data for decision-making?
How easily can employees access and share data across departments?
Is there a culture of collaboration around data stewardship and governance?
Does the organisation have modern data management and analytics tools in place?
How up-to-date is the organisation in adopting the latest data stewardship technologies?
Are employees trained to use data tools effectively?
Are AI-driven insights or automation tools integrated into data stewardship processes?
Are centralised data repositories available and accessible to relevant teams?
Do collaboration tools support secure and efficient data sharing?
Is data security and compliance embedded within data management tools?
Are data tools regularly evaluated and updated to meet industry best practices?
Is the data directly applicable to business goals and objectives?
Is the data easily accessible by authorised users without unnecessary barriers?
